ingredients: Salt and Black Pepper to taste
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the linguine and cook according to package directions until al dente.
While the pasta is cooking, melt the shortening in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the chopped green bell pepper and bay leaf to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes, until softened.
Add the grape tomatoes to the skillet and cook for 5-7 minutes, until they start to soften and release their juices. Gently crush a few tomatoes with the back of a spoon to release more flavor.
In a small bowl, whisk together the cream cheese, egg yolks, and grated nutmeg until smooth.
Drain the cooked linguine, reserving about 1/2 cup of the pasta water.

Add the linguine to the skillet with the tomatoes and peppers.  Pour in the cream cheese mixture and stir constantly until the sauce thickens and coats the pasta. Add a little of the reserved pasta water if the sauce is too thick.
Stir in the chopped fresh mint and thyme.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Remove the bay leaf before serving.
response.name: Creamy Linguine with Grape Tomatoes and Fresh Herbs
